intro: Tragopogon subacaulis, commonly known as the slender goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces slender, sparsely branched stems. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
